snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia listed seven steps that he said were necessary for a cease-fire in the conflict in eastern Ukraine and said that he and the president of Ukraine, Petro O. Poroshenko, had a similar understanding about what was...
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin, ahead of NATO meeting focused on Russian aggression, unveils a seven-point peace plan for Ukraine that he claims emerged from talks with Ukrainian Pres Petro O Poroshenko; his plan muddies diplomatic waters, leaving West an excuse for delaying punitive sanctions that would also hurt European economies on verge of new recession, and is expected to have some appeal to war-weary Ukrainians.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew Roth and Alexandra Odynova from Moscow; Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Tallinn, Estonia; Rick Gladstone from New York; and Maïa de la Baume from Paris.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia listed seven steps that he said were necessary for a cease-fire in the conflict in eastern Ukraine and said that he and the president of Ukraine, Petro O. Poroshenko, had a similar understanding about what was needed.

headline.main: Putin Lays Out Proposal to End Ukraine Conflict
headline.print_headline: Putin Lays Out Proposal to End Ukraine Conflict
